name: reconviction
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of officially finding someone guilty of a crime after they have been convicted (= found guilty of a crime) before, in the past, or of being found to be guilty of a crime in this way: The reconviction rate for former prisoners is 61%. The centre was especially successful in reducing reconvictions among the highest-risk offenders.
More examplesFewer examplesThe group showed a significantly lower level of reconviction after two years.Information on convictions and reconvictions is not the same thing as information on offending and reoffending.Offenders given community service orders had a lower re-conviction rate of 42%.
